snippet: An Idaho couple’s fight with the Environmental Protection Agency could undermine environmental controls.
abstract: Editorial urges Supreme Court to rule against against Idaho couple Chantell and Michael Sackett, who sued the Environmental Protection Agency after being ordered to remove fill on their lot that sits on federally protected wetlands; argues that if court allows landowners to challenge EPA orders, they will delay in correcting the harm they caused and hand a victory to corporations and developers who want to evade the requirements of the Clean Water Act.
lead_paragraph: An Idaho couple’s fight with the Environmental Protection Agency could undermine environmental controls.

headline.seo: The Sacketts and the Clean Water Act
headline.main: The Sacketts and the Clean Water Act
headline.print_headline: The Sacketts and the Clean Water Act
